newsitem.title: UK: Queen Elizabeth sails to special perfomance at Globe.
newsitem.headline: Queen Elizabeth sails to special perfomance at Globe.

text.p: Queen Elizabeth took to the River Thames on a royal barge on Thursday to travel to a special celebration performance at London's Globe Theatre, the open-topped wooden replica of William Shakespeare's playhouse.
"It's a nice way to come to the Globe," said a spokeswoman for the theatre. "It's on the river and it is the way Elizabeth I would have come.'

Zoe Wanamaker, the daughter of the late U.S. actor-director Sam Wanamaker who started the project, performed the prologue to Henry V and members of the Globe Theatre company performed Act IV of the play and an act from The Winter's Tale.
The evening marked the completion of the playhouse that was started in 1987, and was the highlight of a two-week festival.
